website_summaries.verdict: High-quality system with superb feature set can be used indoors or out and is compatible with Alexa.
pros: Simple installation can be fully wireless
1080p HD images stored to cloud for 7 days free or recorded to USB drive
Has 2-way audio, motion detectors, and 100 dB siren, plus versatile smartphone app
cons: Some owners have been critical of customer support

website_summaries.verdict: Version of Arlo camera specifically designed to work with Amazon Alexa for smooth operation.
pros: 2-camera system is a great idea for a basic security network
Includes full HD video resolution with both cameras
Works indoors or outdoors with weather-resistant design
Gives you the ability to speak to people standing near the camera with 2-way audio capability
cons: Some problems with poor battery life may cause cameras to crash

customer_reviews.title: Frequent Offline Failure
customer_reviews.text: All of the blogs are full of individuals reporting the same exact problem: Arlo Pro 2 (unlike the Arlo Pro) will frequently fall offline on its own. Still occurs when plugged directly into power outlet next to the base unit. Reset multiple times and have all applicable firmware. Consistently falls offline now within’ 24hrs of any reconnect.
customer_reviews.author: gigi

customer_reviews.title: Battery only lasts about 3-4 days
customer_reviews.text: Battery only lasts about 3-4 days. I contacted Arlo and they advised me that the estimates of 4-6 month battery life are not meant for City life. The remedy they suggested was to disarm the camera, why would anyone buy a security system and have it disarmed? Do not buy this system, unless you live in the country some place that no one passes by.
customer_reviews.author: Eli Weinstock

customer_reviews.title: Fundamental problem with the Version 2 Arlo Pro.
customer_reviews.text: Please be VERY aware that this product (Arlo Pro 2 1080p) has a serious flaw. It will regularly and randomly go offline and only removing the battery will reset it and bring it back online. When this happens the battery depletes at approximately 10% per hour. Thus completely dead in 10 hours. I have had an Arlo Pro 1 with five cameras for a long time without issue. But the Arlo Pro 2 has a fault and it is fundamental. A lot of people are discussing this on the Netgear community. Please be aware of the before you buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Added features over the Pro, but accessing them requires the camera be plugged in
customer_reviews.text: I added on a new Arlo Pro 2 to my existing base station and camera set-up. Visually the Pro 2 looks very similar to the original. Something I did not anticipate, however, is that a few of the features you may be buying the Pro 2 vs. the Pro for, such as activity zones (for motion detection) and CVR only work when the camera is plugged into AC power.
customer_reviews.author: Casey M Allen

customer_reviews.title: Arlo Pro 1 has much better night vision.
customer_reviews.text: Good daytime picture, but poor reception and awful night vision as compared to the Arlo Pro 1 that it replaced. I won't purchase another Arlo Pro 2 until the night vision is fixed.
customer_reviews.author: Nick F

customer_reviews.title: Arlo Pro 2 is currently not as clear as existing Arlo Pro.
customer_reviews.text: I will let the pictures speak for themselves One camera is literally taped to the other so position is the same. Zoom distance is the same. But as you can see from the pictures Arlo Pro 2 is actually less clear than my Arlo Pro in my back yard. I have contacted Arlo And they have stated they're working on a fix for the night vision problem but my problem was in daylight. Will post a couple pictures showing they license plate that is out of focus and my dog that's in the shade.
customer_reviews.author: George's Garage

customer_reviews.title: Crappy night vision and motion detection!
customer_reviews.text: Absolute garbage! The night vision might as well not even be there, and it picks up the motion of even leaves on the grass. Absolutely useless. It's already used 9% of the battery in just 24 hours. I'm sending it back for another Arlo Pro. Don't waste your money on the Pro 2!
customer_reviews.author: Amberblakebrett

customer_reviews.title: Not working after 1 day
customer_reviews.text: I installed my system yesterday and the network is down. This appears to be happening to everyone right now. Customer support is nonexistent. Very disappointed considering how much i paid for the system and accesories. Would not recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: jared richardson

customer_reviews.title: Run far from Arlo
customer_reviews.text: Run far from Arlo. I did a lot of research before I purchased them. I bough cameras for family. I bought tons for us. I told all my friends about them. But now I can’t access my security cameras the day before Thanksgiving until I agree to a brand new mile long agreement. Run far away from Arlo. No company should ever hold your security footage hostage, because they decided to change a name or wherever they actually did. If it happened once, it will happen again. Don’t trust them.
customer_reviews.author: ~T

customer_reviews.title: Not ready for prime time - Would NOT recommend
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Arlo Pro 2 for a busy sidewalk in-front of my home and quickly moved to power and CVR recording. I found there were gaps of time where the units just stopped recording and later started again on its own, Also the time that video occurred on the CVR timeline does not match the time of video clips and there is ongoing extensive pixelation of the videos. This makes the unit useless for security. I contacted support frequently and have been referred to Tier 2 support. They have been very responsive but the problem continues. This could be a great product but I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND and hopefully sometime (soon) maybe it will become ready for prime time.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Base stopped working within less than 24 hours!
customer_reviews.text: Received this yesterday, the shipping service was very quick. It was not expected for another 2 weeks but it arrived early. The setup was very smooth and it was connected within 5 mins (we bought this item, plus an additional 2 cameras). We hooked them up and they were running from 2PM up to the last recording was at 1:30am. We woke up today to find out that the base is dead!! We paid a total of almost 900 dollars for the whole set. WHAT A WASTE! Don't buy if you are outside of the USA even though amazon ships it worldwide!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality, quality, quality all about the quality
customer_reviews.text: Pro 2 picture and pro It's wasted money to buy pro 2 The picture is not 1080HD the pro 720 seems better then pro 2 I not sure why many other have the same issue but Netgear still selling this product I have until the end of Jan 2019 to return Will try it for two more months if not see any good I will return I currently have 6 Alro, 3 Arlo Pro they all work fine but with this price for Arlo Pro 2 I don't think any one should buy it. If you not sure which one you going to purchase go with Pro not Pro 2
customer_reviews.author: DB888

customer_reviews.title: This Is NOT The Camera System You're Looking For
customer_reviews.text: Update: After using Arlo for some time, I can say that it is not the system for you. Latency (lag) is horrible, 2-way audio sounds awful, there really isn't anything good to say about the system.
customer_reviews.author: Wynne Hexamer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: For being rated quite highly I was very disappointed in the video quality and overall functionality of the cameras. Setup was quick and easy, but video quality was really quite poor no matter where I located the cameras and base. Motion detection for 2 cameras worked for few weeks and then stopped on one of the cameras. Dealing with customer support was painful and time consuming. 5 calls averaging around 45 minutes each time. I final talked a support rep. into replacing these bad camera and then found they wanted me to pay for shipping both ways and give them a credit card number. I ultimately returned the system to Amazon for a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Not worth buying
customer_reviews.text: Within the first two weeks one of the cameras stopped responding to the base station and would not reconnect. I contacted Netfear and I had to pay for shipping and return of one camera. I’m not happy with the constant trouble with this product. Right now I think I’m just settling with this oroduct. Before the camera broke I was able to get real good range and motion detection, with the replacement I don’t get motion detection or range I was used to. I can’t with good intentions recommend this product to anyone, especially if you have to pay your own shipping for a broken equipment. This is unacceptable for such an expensive equipment.
customer_reviews.author: SwayKilljoy

customer_reviews.title: Defective and troublesome product.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased Base and 3 cameras. Set up fine on iPhone but would not load views on PC. Batteries charged on 3 cameras to 100%. NEXT DAY they were down to 63%-71%! I had upgraded to the Pro 2 from Pro because the Pro was so buggy. I surely did not improve anything with this Expensive product. Customer No-Support contacted....56 minute phone wait and then no solution other than to return to Amazon, however my return period was expired at 30 days and I am now 4 days past that. A very bad experience with a non-reliable product and company.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Solid but not amazing
customer_reviews.text: Pro is solid - hardware wasn't too hard to mount, app/web interface is pretty good. A few things that could be improved: - Changing and setting the motion sensitivity (and having it saved) is very counter-intuitive and hard to find. Real PITA. - I set this up right before going out of town and couldn't understand why night vision wasn't working on my camera. After I got back I resync'd it (which may solve the problem), but I'm still troubleshooting this issue. - Activity zones are confusing + require active (plugged in) power source. Kinda annoying that a "wireless" system needs to be plugged in to use all the features
customer_reviews.author: BayAreaTexan

customer_reviews.title: VERY VERY DISAPPOINTED
customer_reviews.text: RETURNING ASAP! Would give ZERO stars if I could. The camera is filming UPSIDE DOWN!!! I shouldn’t have to mount the unit upside down, to get a right side up video! Furthermore...upon arrival, and concern of camera being able to be stolen, right off the [included] magnetic mount...I learned that Arlo has a “Theft replacement” program.... but NOT if it was purchased via third-party. So yes, that would be me, having bought this thing on Amazon! A customer, is a customer! ( I did NOT buy refurbished) It should not matter where I purchased YOUR device/product. That’s pretty crappy customer service!!! You can have your item back. Moving on to a different device. HUGE let down, Arlo!
customer_reviews.author: DMY

customer_reviews.title: Abysmal video compression
customer_reviews.text: 2019 Update. I am now fed up with Arlo's video quality. I needed a license plate for a prowling vehicle. I setup my arlo, on the highest quality setting eight feet from the driveway at bumper level and the license plate was unreadable to the massive video compression applied. Worthless. Looking for another home security camera system. Setup like an Apple device, almost seamless. Took two stars because of the terrible video quality. It's not the resolution, but the video compression. You can't get car license plates, even when setup at hood level right beside the driveway. Very disappointing for a SECURITY camera system.
customer_reviews.author: V

customer_reviews.title: The cameras are great, just wish the solar panel would keep the ...
customer_reviews.text: The cameras are great, just wish the solar panel would keep the camera alive for more than 5 days the point was to keep it charged so i didnt need to take it down... but lost of features great wire free camera if you can plug it into power Edit:later problems. Ive had the cameras for about 2 months but after the first month they just stopped working. Constantly need to re sync them and get them working only to have them not record anything. Or be un synced the next day. Its really annoying and not helpful. I missed the power company coming to my house and have no footage of it.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: ABSOLUTE JUNK after 1.5 years
customer_reviews.text: Terrible Customer Service. Poor image reliability. Constant need to un-sync and resent cameras with base station (per Arlo Support). Also - just like Apple, they program their "Arlo charging device" to be the only charger that works - unnecessary, idiotic, and paranoid company. My devices used to charge with any cable and connector - now after another "miracle" update the charger won't charge any camera ... but sure what .... the poor camera quality wasn't upgraded. If these yahoos want to stay in b business, and force people into their peripherals and "monthly subscriptions", then they need make cameras that just work. Piece of S$*t
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Loh

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product
customer_reviews.text: These people have the WORST customer service, I have had several cameras go bad under warranty and getting a replacement is impossible, it takes weeks to get a new camera after over 4 hours in chat and 8 hours on the phone with these people. Terrible product, do NOT purchase this junk. I have both arlo basic cameras and arlo pro 2 cameras and I am a premium paying member.....
customer_reviews.author: Gregory S. Parton

customer_reviews.title: Worst purchase ever
customer_reviews.text: Tried to set up with no success. Spent 4 hours on online chat waiting with no support and at same time 4 hours on phone for tech and never got any response. Finally resolved partial problem myself but cameras dropped in and out w/o connection ability at their leisure. ALL SERVICES REQUIRE EXTRA MONEY FROM THEM FOR ALARMS AND PUSH ALERTS. DONT BUT / DONT BUY/ DONT BUT!!!! You will be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Bought a lemon - Customer Service wouldnt even try to make lemonade
customer_reviews.text: Their support was horrendous. The only thing the technicians would do is repeatedly have you reset the devices even it was clear they were not working. After spending another evening trying to get this garbage to work I then had to spend hours arguing with them to honor their warranty. I'm actually still arguing with them as we speak. So Hardware=Horrible. Customer Service = Horrible. Stay away.
customer_reviews.author: Redsage74

customer_reviews.title: I can't recommend these cameras.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for a few months this summer. As of October they have been nothing but trouble. They randomly stop recording altogether. This will be the third time I have to remove each camera from my account, remove the battery, then re-add them to my account to get them working again. Live chat support does not work and has never worked from multiple browsers over the last few weeks. (No add-ons or extensions running.) Phone support is abhorrent.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Arlo camera failed just over 2 months old. on your own with Arlo
customer_reviews.text: I purchased camera july 7 one camera failed sept 24 lasted little over 2 months . Arlo customer service is horrible i have spent over 3 hours on phone with arlo reps they claimed they would send replacement. I called again today it was like the first call troubleshoot change out battery ,remove camera,add camera, etc etc same bull just different day. Well back to another replacement on the way! we will see! I feel like throwing all of this crap in the trash. I cannot recommend this product. Also batteries only last a couple to three weeks at best up the ladder down the ladder its crazy not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: SWFL

customer_reviews.title: Great hardware, absolutely awful software/cloud services
customer_reviews.text: The camera itself is great. The cloud services, however, are awful. There are often long delays in connecting. Their software doesn't support LAN access outside of hooking up a USB backup, which doesn't provide realtime updates. The online view uses Flash(who does this in 2020?), which causes Chrome to complain, and you have to add an exception. It seems like they put a lot of money into hardware develop and outsourced software development to the lowest bidder. With so many better options out there, I cannot recommend this unless they start providing a LAN/local option to get around their terrible cloud services. (edit) Dropped it to 1 star. It's been getting worse and worse to the point of being unusable
customer_reviews.author: QwikF3

customer_reviews.title: Arlo VMS4120P-100NAS Pro 2
customer_reviews.text: Advertised as with siren. The round base station that comes with this kit is a VMB-3500. It doesn't have a siren or a speaker. The camera may be nice but it doesn't have a siren either. I returned this and asked Amazon to correct this listing..
customer_reviews.author: C.Farr

customer_reviews.title: camera broke in 7 months, but no product support past 6 months
customer_reviews.text: We bought a home system with 3 cameras last June and a camera broke (issues with the sound) this January. Most brands/companies offer at least a year of warranty/support. These cameras are very pricey and they are presented with blows and whistles. T here's always and recording and the motion detection sometimes doesn't kick in. Also, If you happen to watch live, there will be no recording kept for that particular time. We have a baby at home with a nanny, and we take this extremely seriously. ***NOT RECOMMENDED***
customer_reviews.author: Cam Alexandru

customer_reviews.title: Misleading
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a security camera with no subscription fee. The Arlo Pro2 was shown. What they do not tell you is that it only records during certain daylight preset hours and only what it wants to record. You can not get night time recordings, 24/7 recordings without an expensive subscription per camera. They do not divulge any of this until you ask on-line questions. They show settings but they are not available without subscriptions. The system looks good but for it to do any good you need to sign up for their programs. They advertise no fee and without digging for answers they do little good right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Renee Kinney Metcalf

customer_reviews.title: Not a good product
customer_reviews.text: I have had this product for less than a year. I purchased it in October last YeaR. It started out fine, then the base station would go offline line. It took ages to get the base station connected on the app. I had to contact technical support. Amount of time the base station goes offline and has to be reconnected is appalling. Now the base station goes off and comes back on by itself. Tech support has been no help, leaving my case open for weeks only to close it saying I hadn’t provided any more details when I actually did. I wouldn’t recommend anyone buys this product. It’s money down the drain.
customer_reviews.author: Osaze

customer_reviews.title: Needs physical reset on basestation when power or internet is lost
customer_reviews.text: I bought a 5 camera Arlo Pro 2 a year ago. I love the system and it worked very well for me. During the last year, when the internet connection was lost, the unit would come back on automatically when the internet was restored. At the last software update in June 2019, all that changed. Whenever the internet goes out, the base station goes offline and the unit must be physically reset to get it back online. In the meantime, your cameras are useless. Many people have complained about this issue and it's still not fixed. When you call support, they don't want to acknowledge the problem. It's very disappointing and frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Unknown

customer_reviews.title: Tech support nightmare
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work. 3 calls to tech support using up 5 hours of my time and the system does not work.
customer_reviews.author: travis a poe

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money cameras die after 24 hours
customer_reviews.text: Terrible product all cameras go dead after 24 hours all cameras are also connected to solar panels with batteries fully charged. Arlo customer support is worthless they are based in India and have no idea how to help be on their script. Deleted the entire system three times and also recharged all the batteries three times per Arlo request and still the batteries drain after 24 hours. I’m going back to RING cameras
customer_reviews.author: jetseller

customer_reviews.title: Glad we have them!
customer_reviews.text: We like having the cameras and the price was pretty good. I know we could pay more for better quality and high tech cameras to be more satisfied with the performance but still not very happy with the night vision. Best quality eats up the battery extremely fast. It’s difficult to charge them with the cord that’s included. They should include a charger. Their charger seems overpriced but there are knock offs to try and probably an extra battery would help. They were easy to set up but it takes time to get angles right for the best views. All in all I’m glad we have them despite minor inconveniences.
customer_reviews.author: Rusted50

customer_reviews.title: Pass on this model.
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 of the Pro's. The Pro 2 goes though batteries 3X faster then the Pro. Night vision is almost useless. And picture quality is marginally better than the Pro. Also recently got 3 Ultra's - 4k on one and 1080 on 2. Night vision is excellent, picture quality good. I don't notice any improvement on 4k. 1080 is far better than on Pro 2. I would recommend skipping the Pro 2 (poor battery life, poor night vision) and get the pro or Ultra depending on budget.
customer_reviews.author: William B Winfield

customer_reviews.title: They factory sealed/sold me a used camera!
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited to set up these cameras but the moment I opened them I found one of the cameras looked faded, as if it had been outside for a long time. Check out the picture. What is most disappointing is that the obviously used/refurbished camera was repackaged in a bag and factory sealed with an 'arlo' logo on it >:( Super cheap move arlo! They are reselling old and used cameras for "new" price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unsatisfied
customer_reviews.text: Not very happy with this system. I use it mostly to monitor my front door. There is what I feel is too long of a delay in the live video feed and for whatever reason when you get a notification of movement you are not allowed to access the camera until well after whatever is transpiring has taken place. It is useless. Someone took my Jeep right out of my driveway. I was notified that there was movement but I wasn't allowed to access the camera until long after it was gone.
customer_reviews.author: M. C.

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 2 weeks in rain
customer_reviews.text: One of the 2 cameras quit after 2 weeks. Gave a charge error. Found water inside and contacted Arlo support. The person I spoke with said it is not water resistant and they would not warranty it. Offered to replace and said it is temporarily out of stock call back in 2 days. Second person offered an RMA and never provided it. The Arlo web site states the camera is IP65 and rain proof. It was not. I have an earlier version that has been working in the rain for over 2 years. This design is defective and support was horrible. I am returning it to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Novak

customer_reviews.title: Arlo Pro 2-Terrible Night Vision
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: daytime works great. The night vision is horrendous. It’s a deal-breaker. The original Arlo was far better. I’m uploading a sample. There is a dog walking in front of the camera in this video. Reducing my 5-Star rating to 3. I have three original Arlo cameras and recently purchased an Arlo Pro 2. The image is much clearer with the 1080, especially when you zoom in. It’s also nice to be able to hear what’s gong on outside when you review a video or click the “Live” button. The original base station supports the new camera perfectly. It was nice to see I didn’t have to upgrade anything else to use the new camera.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun

customer_reviews.title: Amazing picture quality
customer_reviews.text: My husband had previously purchased a much cheaper security camera for in home use and the batteries wouldn't last more than a couple of weeks and we'd often have an issue with being able to access the camera remotely - rendering the system completely useless. I finally convinced my husband to spend a little bit more money on a better system after seeing the picture quality from a friends Arlo system. It's been 5 months since we installed the cameras in our house and we haven't had to charge the batteries at all and we've had no issue with accessing the cameras via the app. Would highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Nyoung12

customer_reviews.title: 2-4 second lag
customer_reviews.text: I called in because of lag issues and got awful customer service. I can't believe she questioned my honesty after I told her I have a 200 Mbit internet service. She actually asked me to send her a screenshot for verification of my speed. She questioned my wireless router distance and informed her that I set the router up 10 feet from the first and 20 ft from the second and did not believe me. I tried different quality settings for video and with direct power also and it did not help. The lag is the same as my regular first gen Arlo set.
customer_reviews.author: sam

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price tag
customer_reviews.text: We had high hopes for this camera system. At first we thought it was just right, but soon realized many of the functions we wanted the system for didn't work properly. The cameras picked up motion only a short distance away even with a large are in view and when we used the app to view video after a notification, the video would take sometimes up to 5 minutes to load even when there was excellent wifi signal. This product is pretty much a $40 system with a $400 price tag! Had to be returned.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie F.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality product - love it.
customer_reviews.text: Added this camera to a six-camera original version system. Worked just fine right out of the box and has slightly better vision and color sense. Totally easy to work with and the batteries last several weeks before needing to be exchanged. Batteries recharge within an hour on the charger that I bought for it. Good investment. More often than not I will check if the sytem detects movements at times when no one should be outside or on our property. More often than not its a car passing by or a squirrel running through the yard - but that's what I wanted to have happen. I totally recommend the Arlo system and it's well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: John H.

customer_reviews.title: Great so far!
customer_reviews.text: Just got this for the front inside of my house and it’s pretty awesome so far. Very clear video, I love that it stores videos on the app for up to seven days. I definitely feel more secure the only thing I don’t like is how sensitive the motion sensors are I’ve even turn it down but a bird, a cat, my dog, or just the wind blowing the trees and bushes sets it off. Otherwise great product and 10 out of 10 will be buying some more again for the inside of my home!
customer_reviews.author: Aly B.

customer_reviews.title: Barely Better Than the Arlo Pro - NOT What I'd call HD Video; Battery Life Terrible
customer_reviews.text: EDIT: After having this camera for about 18 months, the battery no longer holds a charge. 20 years ago, this would have been great. However, it's now 2019, and we should be getting at least 2 years (and usually more) from a rechargeable battery. Original Review: The Arlo Pro 2 provides marginally better quality over the regular Arlo Pro. While it might meet the technical specifications for 1080p video, it's not in any way the kind of crisp video you might expect from a 1080p Amazon Prime movie. In other words, it's disappointingly blurry. I guess HD video means different things to different people, depending on whether you're buying or selling.
customer_reviews.author: Weird Ralph

customer_reviews.title: Sound could be more sensitive
customer_reviews.text: The hardware is impressive. It the internet or software is terrible. It keeps going offline line at my vacation house that 100 mile away. Customer service says to manually reset the router. That’s not going to happened for weeks to make a special trip just to deal with this problem. Reading online support it might be a port opening problem with the router. I am not a computer WiFi tech like most people are not. If your in the business of making security systems make them easy to install. A lot of money for something that doesn’t work out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Bob M

customer_reviews.title: awesome setup, everything in one package
customer_reviews.text: I am a little surprised just how good this setup is. the picture, sound, motion detection, options, range, setup ease of use, app config all VERY GOOD. i was shocked that it actually had a speaker for me to talk out of ON the CAMERA! THAT is cool! I was able to yell "get off my lawn" from the comfort of the couch. About the only cons are if you are watching live feed and it starts to record, you lose picture and that it can take a few minutes for a sensor activated recording to hit the app dashboard but those are more of design limitations rather than flaws. I definitely plan on expanding the setup in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Christe

customer_reviews.title: I'm extremely skeptical...
customer_reviews.text: I just received this 2 camera system and immediately found I've been misled as to the mounting option(s) included. This is due primarily because their questionably vague in the type(s) of wall mounts you get and when speaking to Arlo customer service they apparently don't know either. Now, instead of installing the system I have to order the mount (inclusive in the pictures provided of this system) I was led to believe was included in the package. I'm skeptical that this will work as I hope just because the lead-in regarding the simple stuff was so ham-handed, and the support, for lack of better word, is...atrocious and likely third world.
customer_reviews.author: D. Diggs

customer_reviews.title: Dont Buy
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this as an add on for a Pro2 2 camera kit that had been working flawlessly... and after a short time I found that this unit is horrible compared to the original kit. Awful Night vision, was over powered by interference from wifi or cellular or maybe just dust? I don't know. I also found that this unit is a much earlier hardware and software than on the year old kit.. I thought I bought "NEW" .. Oh also I noted that the field of view is about 2/3 of the the kit cameras? .... I will not buy again... No way
customer_reviews.author: j

customer_reviews.title: Good camera and Easy Setup
customer_reviews.text: The camera has great quality and is easy to setup. It's one of the few camera systems still available that doesn't require a monthly contract to be useful, which is a must-have for me. For the price though, I have since found some options that are much less expensive that offer the same, if not better video online storage. My biggest complain lies in the time the camera takes to start recording and when activity in an activity zone is triggered. Typically people are already walking to the house when the video starts as a result of the motion detection. I'm still very pleased with the camera purchase and it's doing a great job.
customer_reviews.author: JWNite

customer_reviews.title: Great usability
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these cameras for 6 months now, after moving homes. We previously had a professionally installed camera system with a DVR and high-end cameras that cost around $350 each. I prefer this Arlo system greatly compared with that, despite it being 1/4 the cost (when you factor in the installation). The usability is really good with the mobile application to review recorded clips. The video quality is good, much better during the day time or if there is a little ambient light. The audio works fine too, although I haven't used it for having a conversation.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Ease of installation and versatility of application
customer_reviews.text: Bought this on a Cyber Monday 6 months (MOL) ago and they have performed flawlessly ever since. The system we purchased came with 3 cameras and were "perfect" for our application. The system with Arlo cloud support, works great and the install & maintenance (i.e., battery recharging) have been simple and easy. Looked at several systems beforehand but to find a system TRULY portable (no video wire, and NO power wiring) that works this well in sunlight, night periods, and heavy rains has been difficult, until we obtained the ARLO Pro 2 system.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Cole

customer_reviews.title: Serves the purpose
customer_reviews.text: Placed on front of house toward garage and front door. Picture quality excellent. Power on all the time with outside power. Wish list: 1. Human detection to avoid dogs, cats, rabbit, etc detection 2. Increased volume for talking to persons. Mounted 10 feet up and and 15 feet away from front door. Tested and sound quality to talk is very poor to worthless. 3. Best used if main Arlo box is hardwired to router. Works OK for me but if your cameras are a great distance you may be in trouble. I tried a repeater and connection was not that stable.
customer_reviews.author: WT

customer_reviews.title: Horrible support
customer_reviews.text: Overall, we were happy with our cameras at first, but they lose battery charge quickly and after just a few months one went bad. When I contacted support, they had me on the phone for a total of three hours before determining it was defective. They gave me instructions for returning it. I followed the directions and had it delivered and signed for. They can't find it in their warehouse and are refusing to send a replacement even though they have proof of delivery. Their support team has been infuriating. I will not purchase from ARLO again.
customer_reviews.author: Speech Mom

customer_reviews.title: Great Security System
customer_reviews.text: I have had Arlo cameras now for 6 months and love them. They provide clear pictures, automatic recording, internet access and the security we wanted without a monthly subscription. The batteries are rechargeable, recharge quickly, and last a long time. I think I have recharged them twice in 6 months, but neither time were they completely depleted. That little bit of hassle is much better than the expense and trouble of installing a wired system. These cameras can be installed in minutes almost anywhere. If convenient to your location, they can also be plugged into a standard outlet or a solar charger.
customer_reviews.author: LBM@WENDELL

customer_reviews.title: So happy I finally got these!
customer_reviews.text: These are excellent cameras! The clarity is beautiful. The battery life is amazing. It’s all good! I’ve wanted security cameras for ages, but never found any that fit all of my needs. I wanted a camera that was completely wireless with high quality video and that didn’t require a monthly fee. These are them! I haven’t had a single issue with them not working or disconnecting from my wi-if. I’m thinking perhaps people are placing their cameras too far from the signal? My router is downstairs where my cameras are located. I’d definitely purchase again. I actually might get a couple more to place in the front and back of the house.
customer_reviews.author: CrystalTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Good camera overall but glitches in software
customer_reviews.text: I really do like these cameras which are a secondary system to my security system. Only problem is the software which can take a fair amount of time to load, etc. They did a huge improvement recently (software update) which helped significantly but there's still some delays in seeing what's going on which is frustrating. If these were you first line of defense I wouldn't feel comfortable because of the delay in seeing what's going on, but as a secondary system they perform adequately.
customer_reviews.author: Robert F.

customer_reviews.title: Piece of mind
customer_reviews.text: Hands down the most reliable and affordable wireless camera system. This is my Second Arlo system, about 5 years ago i bought the original Arlo 4 camera kit. The wifi signal range is outstanding, i have 2 of the cameras over 50' from the base station, crystal clear 1080p resolution. The App alerts you just about instantly via push notification and or email. Installation is quick and easy, the battery life is great, the cameras accurately discern motion from a person or animal and the battery life is so much better than the original Arlo system. I love my Arlo Pro 2 cameras and the piece of mind they give me.
customer_reviews.author: PC

customer_reviews.title: Cameras are too sensitive
customer_reviews.text: The system was easy to install. The base station must be close to the internet modem or a router with an available port. The cameras provide good resolution but are very sensitive to movement. Mine are outdoors and a breeze moving a limb is all that’s needed to trigger the camera, which sends an alert to my phone indicating movement. I can mute the notifications for only 24 hours, which defeats the purpose of having live cameras. To mute for longer periods requires a $20 per month subscription! I cannot find a happy medium between alerts and security. I would not purchase this system again, at least for outdoor use!
customer_reviews.author: Heartwood Farm

customer_reviews.title: Not good for instant security
customer_reviews.text: The cameras are great for archiving activity, so they would work well, for example, on a vacation home, where you just want to know what's has happened during the day. However if alarmed event is detected, it takes about 30 to 40 seconds before you can look at anything. If you turn on the microphone, you can talk immediately through the camera, but image and response from other end is again about 30 to 40 seconds behind. The marketing description should be more up front about this. Arlo does market a doorbell system that might be more effective for this need.
customer_reviews.author: ncg

customer_reviews.title: Better than Blink sort of
customer_reviews.text: Scheduling can't be turned on to go overnight. Arlo says use Geofencing. Nice bait and switch. I'd rather my cameras not be dependent on my cell phone. How about a real scheduling option? Website documentation doesn't really explain what features come without paying a monthly fee. It's more a figure it out yourself and pay us when you get frustrated situation. And yes I've seen the website, after you open up the camera options on the app you'll say "wow there's a lot they left out on the website." Camera's are much better quality than Blink, and the system is fine for the upfront price. There's more value to this system as a neighborhood watch tool than personal security.
customer_reviews.author: shobe what

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd camera system I’ve had and this is by far the best! The wireless works great! I have a brick house and that has caused many problems with my previous systems but for this it’s no problem. The clarity is great. My only complaint is that in order to use activity zone alerts the cameras must be plugged in which I didn’t anticipate. But hey small trade off for a phenomenal product
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: AI feature is killing it
customer_reviews.text: No problems with the cameras or the system itself. The problem is with Arlo forcing us to have AI based detection that identities vehicles, people, animals etc. This causes notifications of an alert on the camera to be severely delayed while the Arlo servers process what the camera is seeing. So you won't get notified that someone is breaking into your house until minutes, sometimes upwards of 5 or so later. Arlo needs to either disable this feature or at least give us an option. Before this was forced on us, activity notifications were near instant.
customer_reviews.author: JoeyC

customer_reviews.title: Very high quality for the price !
customer_reviews.text: We own some acreage and have a pole barn on property with lots of toys in it. A couple weeks ago we had three people trying to get into it. A deputy sheriff actually recommended this product to us and we love it. Great quality of camera clarity and product durability. The camera will pick up anything that comes into its viewing area, specifying if it is an animal or person. The notification of each camera will come to your phone along with sound ! You can zoom in and out also with your phone of what is captured. It will allow you to talk to someone from each camera also. Very pleased with product, highly recommend !!!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt charge, has false events with slight movement of leafs
customer_reviews.text: I was very optimistic when I purchased these cameras. It is so sad that a product costs over $400 doesnt work properly. It doesnt charge, events are false so often then true. The batteries drain so fast because of false events makes so inconvenient to a piece of mind. I am always on the latter climbing up and down to remove the charger so it would charge and still sometimes it does sometimes the battery just completely drains where I have to go up there take it down and take the batteries out and start them over. Tired of it!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Edessa

customer_reviews.title: Great cameras, slight night vision issue
customer_reviews.text: The cameras are quite the upgrade from original Arlo, but I don't think the video quality is any better vs 720 to 1080p, unless I have something setup wrong or need to pay for a subscription. My major complaint is the night vision, porch lights keep it from triggering the night vision to turn on, I never had issues with the original Arlo cameras, same spot, same lightbulbs
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Excellent video security device
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research and reading of reviews prior to purchasing the Arlo system for my office. The setup and installation was easy. They are very low profile and provide excellent picture/video quality. I have had a variety of systems in the past and this is by far the easiest to use with the best video quality. The phone app works seamlessly and even allows you to share videos via text and email. I have actually enjoyed the system because it allows me to view my office at all times and if I choose speak directly through the camera speaker using my phone. I would easily recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Picture, Sound, and Mic! Free 7 days of Footage too!
customer_reviews.text: These are literally the best cameras I have had! The picture quality is incredible! The sound that the cameras pick up our crystal clear and them mic works perfectly! I don't know what others are talking about when they are saying the app is horrible. The app has been working perfectly for my Galaxy S7 amdy wife's iPhone 6s. And my buddy had a slight problem with the app at first but then he just uninstalled and reinstalled it and hasn't had a problem since. we love these cameras on the fact that we get an additional 7 days of footage for free, tops everything off! Go with the Arlo Pro 2's and you won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Rell

customer_reviews.title: Best option for 5 or less camera needs.
customer_reviews.text: They are wireless, good quality video, good quality night video, good quality audio, can install and adjust in minutes. And if you get the arlo 2 pro it still comes with free cloud storage for trigger videos. And if you want to add more cameras later, the newer arlo cameras are backward compatible to the arlo 2 base. In my opinion this is the best choice for 5 or less camera needs.
customer_reviews.author: jrd100

customer_reviews.title: Wish I could give it a better review
customer_reviews.text: Started off great, I was almost getting too many notifications about motion. Then all of a sudden..nothing. no recordings, no motion alerts. I deleted everything and reset it all..nothing. got the live feed with lag but that's about it. I'll try calling but not too confident after reading the other reviews. Otherwise the battery life has been realistic and fine and the pic quality as well. Wish I could give this I better review.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really buggy so far.
customer_reviews.text: Really buggy so far. I followed the QuickStart guide, but ended up removing and reinstalling to get the cameras up and running. The connection to the base is constantly dropping off in a way that suggests some sort of double NATing. And the app interface is less than intuitive and preferences don’t seem to stick. I finally went to the community help group to find out the way to avoid email notification is to not give them your email... why wouldn’t having your email tied to your account and having a text only option for notification be possible? I don’t want to delete hundreds of emails a month from Arlo. I’m not impressed so far.
customer_reviews.author: Duke

customer_reviews.title: That the system is reliable
customer_reviews.text: Cameras are just OK you get a average cheap system. Don't be fooled this is NOT a professional system. No coherent Tech support, NONE!!! So you are on your own for any help. Polite people but useless. I would give it Zeroooo stars if I could. Extremely frustrating .Look for another system. Not reliable at all. If you like to troubleshoot problems yourself then this is for you if not. Buy something else. I am an accomplished trouble shooter for a major utility company for 31years,just keep that in mind before you decide to purchase.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up, good quality video.
customer_reviews.text: This is the forth set of Arlo's I have set up. Three different locations for myself, and one for a buddy. Total of 9 cameras and 4 hubs. The only glitch was on resetting one hub, instructions say to press and hold reset button for 10 seconds but it really takes around 40 seconds. Other than that, all installed easily. Battery life for some of my cameras is about 5 weeks due to lots of cats and dogs setting them off. The other cameras last about 2 months before needing a charge. I most likely will add more cameras to my system(s) as Arlo is GTG.
customer_reviews.author: Lesley

customer_reviews.title: Decent quality but problems with the actual cameras
customer_reviews.text: These cameras worked well, i bought them last june 2019 and now its may 2020 and ive had two issues. One was a battery quit charging. They shipped me out a new battery. Now this month one of the cameras just stopped working. Even though i payed all that money for these cameras and theyre supposed to have a one year warranty, they still want me to pay for a new camera to be shipped to me. Really cant believe after having issues twice in a year with two different cameras that i still have to pay out of pocket to get a replacement. Wonder how many will go out after the warranty is up?
customer_reviews.author: Sheila Pevey

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: These are great and easy to use. We just got back from a 3 week trip and were able to constantly check the house. The cameras even picked up movement from ground squirrels. You can adjust the sensitivity if you do not want it going off on small motion too. The cameras are clear, audio great, and in 3 weeks the batteries are still going strong. We were initially worried the batteries would wear out while we were away. The install is easy too.
customer_reviews.author: LilSoph

customer_reviews.title: Good camera for HomeKit
customer_reviews.text: The only reason i bought this because it works with HomeKit according to the website. And yes, it works pretty well with the HomeKit, even remotely. I feel much more secure now as it can sense the motions very well. Although the website says it senses the pet, it does not sense my cat after i lower down the sensitivity. This is well as i do not want to get notification because of my cat walking around. Although it works with HomeKit, some features still only can be accessed through the Arlo apps. Examples the audio communication, watch the recorded videos, etc.So far i like the product a lot and might get one more camera.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money on this mediocrity
customer_reviews.text: Worthless!, and now they even became ridiculously overpriced., Not that I would ever buy them again. Most of the time they time out when you try to connect, even though the wifi router is within 30 feet. The video is choppy and often with a 10 sec delay. Night vision is terrible and blurry. The rechargeable batteries drain within a few days in an area of frequent motion. So good luck with those you mount outside of immediate reach. Trully subpart product
customer_reviews.author: Irenie_K

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price...
customer_reviews.text: These work great but the motion detection has a 5 second delay which is annoying... picture quality is pretty good. I wish you could have different notifications per camera... it's hard to know which camera is triggered when you have more than one with the same chime. Yes it tells which zone it is... but you can only set up on chime no matter how many cameras you have. unless you have different bases for certain cameras.
customer_reviews.author: Wade

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I did a TON of research on different camera systems and decided on Arlo. I'm very happy. I had them hooked up wirelessly at first (I did buy third-party mounts for more security than just putting them up with a magnet), and they were great. Battery barely moved after a week or so. I made the decision to run some long USB wire to all of them (wasn't too hard with my placements) so I could use the motion activity zones and not have to every worry about changing the batteries. Everything about these is top-notch. Very happy, highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory S. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Arlo Pro 2 Just Okay
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the images of the Arlo Pro 2 are okay compared to the Arlo Pro, but I don't notice that much of a difference between the two models. The biggest disappointment for me is that the Arlo Pro 2 battery drains too fast compared to the Arlo Pro model. This happens even when the solar panel charger is attached to the Arlo Pro 2. For the Arlo Pro, I hardly ever had to change the battery when I attached a solar panel charger. Also, the black skins I use for my Arlo Pro don't look as good with the Arlo Pro 2.
customer_reviews.author: LGG

customer_reviews.title: Mostly good, overall worth it, but GEOFENCING needs to work!
customer_reviews.text: The FREE 1 week video storage is the SOLE reason I chose this camera above all others. Geofencing does not work. There is an excessive 5+ minute (if not more!) delay when it registers I have left or arrived home. Sometimes it never arms/disarms until I open the app manually. App has been set to be excluded from battery optimization. Live view has about a 3 second feed delay, which is manageable but not conducive to real time talking. Battery life seems to be as advertised and great for a wireless camera. Both the motion and audio sensitivity seem to be reliable and without excessive delay.
customer_reviews.author: EmptieHand

customer_reviews.title: Run away fast. Zero company support
customer_reviews.text: If I could give it a negative number I would. Took multiple try’s to get it to connect the base station. Then it couldn’t make it past the firmware update. Deleted it and now it won’t connect to the app. Tried help in app mostly goes to sales or community solutions. Finally found a chat link and tried that. It didn’t work. Found a phone number. It didn’t work. This company is totally useless. Oh, the iPhone link that allows you to manually add the base station doesn’t work either. Factory reset doesn’t work. I think it’s just a box with a blinking light.
customer_reviews.author: Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I love the Arlo cameras they protect my family and I. They’re so easy to set up, the high definition 1080p kicks butt!There customer service is also fantastic. I had an error code on one camera, wouldn’t link to HuB, so they walked me right through the steps. I highly recommend these Arlo cameras! Oh... did I mention they are wireless, no messing around with wires and drilling holes.
customer_reviews.author: Eian

customer_reviews.title: Well Worth the Investment
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased the original Arlo system many years ago, and I'm happily amazed at the quality of the picture, both during the day and night, night vision's range for providing a quality video, and the use of rechargeable batteries in these cameras. When purchasing these cameras, I also decided to buy the floodlight with the camera built-in, speaker, etc.. Not only was I impressed with the floodlight but so were others. "Damn! That's bright!" is what I heard and I love it. Bottom Line: I would buy it again, and again.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: I performed reviews to pay a fairly high amount of money and this looks like a gadget people just buy to feel cool about
customer_reviews.text: Two cameras stopped giving alerts and recording. There is no way to rely on this system. I performed reviews to pay a fairly high amount of money and this looks like a gadget people just buy to feel cool about. With 2 cameras initially working and now stopped it is not something I feel I can rely on. One of the 2 I reset already. It started working again then within 2 hours stopped. Their community feedback would not accept my questions due to 'tag names' not conforming to acceptable or recognized tags. This is very poor....
customer_reviews.author: Ordinary Customer...

customer_reviews.title: Arlo needs to ramp up their efforts.
customer_reviews.text: Despite this AP2 camera working as it's described & designed to... it's Arlo's software and performance lag that puts the versatility of this camera at a distance from it's competitors. Doesn't always get the full capture from inception of motion trigger to end... and I subscribe to Arlo's premium service, have 1GB internet speed service with 3 WIFI repeaters throughout my house. I need to be better impressed Arlo... you're too busy about your next generation technology and not giving enough attention to your 1st & 2nd generation equipment and accompanying software via end-to-end (Arlo to user, user to Arlo).
customer_reviews.author: New York Area Amazon Prime Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent Product Horrendous customer support
customer_reviews.text: I have quite a number of these cameras while they mostly work, what I find downright infuriating is the lack of responsiveness to consumers when there is a problem. Their app for controlling these cameras is buggy, lacks many features that cameras costing 1/10th the price of these cameras has and we have been asking for certain basic features like "snooze mode" now for 4 years and it's falling on deaf ears. I count more than 300 such requests on the Netgear arlo forums yet "nothing". Buyer beware that while the product may be decent, if the support is lacking then you really have nothing. There are better options out there. Stay away!!
customer_reviews.author: Mike H. Maple Grove, MN

customer_reviews.title: Best home security system?
customer_reviews.text: I spent a few weeks reviewing various security cameras and since the Arlo Pro 2 was highly rated I purchased the base station and a couple of cameras. Fairly easy to set up and get the base station on line. Only issues are lessons learned on mounting and location. Followed by adjusting for motion and filtering. Since installing the day prior to leaving for a week vacation, ended up with a few thousand 20 second videos due to trees, plants and sun shades blowing in the wind. Easily corrected by filtering the motion detection.
customer_reviews.author: Pete Bonesio

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: I found the Arlo Pro 2 to be as described. Delivery was timely. Set-up was easy. Setting the cameras for the appropriate motion detection sensitivity for a particular area takes a trial and error approach. I found wind blowing through trees and shrubbery would initially cause camera triggers which I didn't want. Sensitivity adjustments can be made to correct for this. To maximize time between battery re-charges, the power management settings can be set to lowest video quality which is still quite acceptable. I've had the cameras in use for about a week. So far I'm satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: rc22402

customer_reviews.title: Overall Good Camera but Beware - Night Vision is Not Good!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this camera for several months now. I live in the city where theft is common, and installed the cameras to protect my property. Overall, this camera has done a good job. I love that there is no subscription. The one caveat - last night someone stole a bike from my front porch - I checked the camera this morning and could make out someone stealing the bike but the night vision is bad on this camera to the point where the police were not able to get a good enough picture from the camera footage from last night. The thief was literally a black blob. Bike forever lost! Lesson learned: You cannot rely on this camera's night vision.
customer_reviews.author: Dolloff

customer_reviews.title: Better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: So I initially decided against getting the Arlo Pro 2 because of the negative reviews. But after a co-worker told me about her Arlo system she has had for over a year with no issue I decided to try it. I'm glad I did. I've had mine for 9 months now and it works very well. Set it is super easy battery life is good and functionality is very good too. My only complaint is that Arlo really wants you to get their premium services at a monthly fee. So simple things like defining an area for the motion detection is on available for the premium. bottom line is overall I love the system.
customer_reviews.author: TwoFry

customer_reviews.title: Great wireless camera system. Easy set up
customer_reviews.text: Nice wireless system. Set up is easy when you follow the directions exactly as they read. If you don't follow the directions exactly, you will have problems like I did the first time I tried. Great picture quality. Customizable modes for the variety of needs at different times of the day. You can check in on your phone or your computer whenever you like. Very convenient to keep an eye on my mother in law and her antics. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: R. Benninghoven

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware! Ruled Defective after one day of use
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this system for nearly $1,000. Set up was a breeze, actually. Everything worked well during setup, and shortly after. Then, the app required a firmware update to be sent to the base. As soon as the update was complete, the system crashed. Called tech support- they suggested a factory reboot. Did that. Again, set up was easy. Worked great. Firmware pushed- system failed. Tech support said it was "defective" and to return it to where I bought it. In reading many reviews, this is a common answer from them and replacement units do the same thing. Very disappointed after spending such a great amount of money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No Fast forward feature
customer_reviews.text: The cameras are not terrible for the price. The "upgrade features" however are a joke. You can record 24 hours of video and it will take you 24 hours to play it back. How is that helpful. To make matters work, you can't even download the video and watch it on a 21st century platform. At least that is what I could understand from their "customer service".
customer_reviews.author: Daniel J Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Easy and Effective. Nice app, too.
customer_reviews.text: We bought the system to monitor our US home while we live in Europe for a few years. Set-up was easy. They've worked great, and it's nice to be able to check on things while we're away. The system has worked so well that we've since added two more cameras. Several of the cameras are powered only by the solar panel, and we've never had a problem with dead batteries. The only negative is that we get a lot of motion alerts for a tree branch that moves in the wind. I'd love to set up a zone to ignore motion from that small part in the field of view. Unfortunately, I haven't found a way to do that.
customer_reviews.author: BB & T

customer_reviews.title: happy so far
customer_reviews.text: We've had the product for 2 weeks now. We were able to get all 3 cameras hung and connected to the app. They are nice, small, and discreet. Video quality is good, better than our Piper (killed by a close lightening strike). Haven't had to charge the batteries on Arlo yet. Cons: I miss the "Armed-Home" mode Piper had, so it recorded video but didn't sound the alarm. I can't find a commensurate option with Arlo. I don't like that the company keeps trying to sell us storage and other features.
customer_reviews.author: cappakis

customer_reviews.title: Decent Cameras, HORRIBLE APP
customer_reviews.text: Let me start off by saying the camera quality and features are great. The app is just a terrible mess, and never works. I've never been a fan of the app, but in the last month or two it has gotten so bad that my cameras are barely useable. The schedule function now no longer seems to work, and half the time I go into the app and it says "cameras are offline blah blah blah" even though they are not offline, as I would be checking the app BECAUSE they just alerted me to motion. So terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: a lot of issues and they are not usable as security cameras
customer_reviews.text: Most features won't work without signing up for extra monthly charge service or connected to a POWER cord. Motion detection misses A LOT of motions even at highest sensitivity. Needs constant recharging .. and you must send data to their server . Definitely can't use it as security cameras since most actions are not getting recorded. Even pointing all 3 cameras at one area, they all recorded same 1 or 2 minutes and all missed to record the next few minutes. In short, you will need power cords, need to pay monthly service, need to send data over internet to record and to view, need constant recharging, you will not catch most critical frames.. too many issues.
customer_reviews.author: User1010201

customer_reviews.title: Great Cameras. Love the Apple Watch Integration UPDATE
customer_reviews.text: I purchase two Arlo Pro 2 cameras to replace two POE cams and love the ease of use plus the Apple Watch integration. I'll get screen shots of motion alerts on my watch. These are very easy to set up and the video quality is very good. 07/16/2020 Update After having these cameras for around 8 months now I've found that it takes them over a minute to connect to see live view. I have two wired and one on battery and gig speed fiber optic internet and wifi coverage is great all around my house. I have one Ring camera still and it connects immediately. Not real happy with these cameras.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kiser
